attributes.comment:
I have adopted three children from Asia. The first in Jan., 1997, 2nd July 2000,
the 3rd Sept of 2006. The fees have gone up considerably since our first
adoption. I guess I would not mind the fee increases so much if the service
were to improve as was promised but that is just not the case. Adoption is
already an extremely expensive endeavor. Families are at the mercy of all of
the systems whose hoops they have to jump through to become parents. These are
law abiding, tax paying, citizens who are getting taken advantage of at a time
when our country should be cutting them some breaks not BREAKING them! Our
three adoptions cost in the neighborhood of 20,000.00 each. We are not rich, we
just wanted to parent children who needed someone to love, feed and shelter
them. We have no regrets for having adopted as we do love our children very
much. The only regret I do have is that my country feels the need to continue
raising the fees for immigration services but continues to lower the quality of
service!

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Patricia Coleman
